summary: This is a sincere question from a Jonsa shipper to a Jonerys shipper. What do you think of when Jon said to Daenerys, “I would...
question: This is a sincere question from a Jonsa shipper to a Jonerys shipper. What do you think of when Jon said to Daenerys, “I would bend the knee BUT.” ? Jon told Sansa that everything before the word “but” is horseshit. I think this is a huge hint that undercover!jon is true. I just want to see how you and your fellow shippers interpret that without causing a scene by tagging a bunch of you in a meta about it. Toodles.
answer:
Hello anon. Honestly, I interpreted the scene as Jon would bend the knee if he wasn’t naked. It would have been inappropriate for him to throw his furs off in front of Daenerys at that point. He was also waking up for the very first time after being injured and nearly drowning. His body was weak, yet another reason to stay in bed until he’s fully recovered.

If he was fully able , and dressed, and still said those same lines, there might be a case to be made, but we have to take into account all the circumstances and can’t ignore the fact that he was bedridden. In fact, when he was fully recovered and able to pledge to Dany, he made it a point of doing so, in front of everyone at the Dragonpit, regardless of the risk with ruining the alliance.

I’m 100% sure that Undercover Jon just isn’t happening. There’s no reason for it. Jon already had everything he needed (Dany’s army, dragons, and dragonglass) before he chose to bend the knee and he would never be intimate with a woman he didn’t truly love. Just my 2 cents!

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: *fair warning this is pretty rambly* “If Sansa was gone too, there were no more Starks but her. Jon was on the Wall a thousand...
body:
*fair warning this is pretty rambly*

“If Sansa was gone too, there were no more Starks but her. Jon was on the Wall a thousand leagues away, but he was a Snow, and these different aunts and uncles the Hound wanted to sell her to, they weren’t Starks either. They weren’t wolves.” - Arya XIII, ASoS

I find this quote really interesting coming from Arya. Arya is arguably the person that Jon is closest to at Winterfell, though Robb might be a contender…actually they might be tied, but that is a whole different meta. The point is that Jon and Arya are very close and find acceptance with each other that they do not find with other people. Because of that i think we forget that Arya, as much as she hero-worships and loves Jon, still has a tendency to separate him and, for lack of a better term, Catelyn’s family. 

Take this quote for example:

“In there she was Arya of Winterfell, the daughter of Lord Eddard Stark and Lady Catelyn, who had once had brothers named Robb and Bran and Rickon, a sister named Sansa, a direwolf called Nymeria, a half brother named Jon Snow.” - Arya II, AFfC

She does not put Jon in the line up with her brothers from Catelyn, in fact in this list Jon comes last, though in most cases he comes first or at least high up there.

There is also the weird habit she has of referring to him as “Jon Snow” instead of simply Jon. 

“I did not!“ she shouted. Jon Snow had given her Needle. Maybe she had to let them call her Lumpyhead, but she wasn’t going to let them call Jon a thief.” - Arya I, ACoK

“She yearned to see her mother again, and Robb and Bran and Rickon … but it was Jon Snow she thought of most .” - Arya I, ACoK

“Alone, she slid through the shadow of the Tower of Ghosts. She walked fast, to keep ahead of her fear, and it felt as though Syrio Forel walked beside her, and Yoren, and Jaqen H'ghar, and Jon Snow.” - Arya X, ACoK

“NO!” Arya and Gendry both said, at the exact same instant. Hot Pie quailed a little. Arya gave Gendry a sideways look. He said it with me, like Jon used to do, back in Winterfell. She missed Jon Snow the most of all her brothers.” - Arya I, ASoS

“But that was stupid. Her home was gone, her parents dead, and all her brothers slain but Jon Snow on the Wall.” - Arya I, AFfC

“Needle was Jon Snow’s smile. He used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes.” - Arya II, AFfC

“She had never cared if she was pretty, even when she was stupid Arya Stark. Only her father had ever called her that. Him, and Jon Snow, sometimes.” - The Ugly Little Girl, ADwD

Maybe because it happens usually in Arya’s early chapters Martin is simply trying to remind people about who is who, but that seems odd since Jon never refers to Arya as Arya Stark to remind readers who she is. 

I think it is subtle, but i think Arya did struggle somewhat with Jon being her half brother. I think she was torn in her own way between love/loyalty/respect for her mother and her love for her half-brother who accepted who she was.

tags: albert of saxe coburg and gotha
title: Breaking the Wheel
body:
The Pack

Jon and Daenerys were seated at the table in the central hall of the Fortress, separating the letters the family had received.

One of them was from Robb, where he counted the following:

My beloved brother Jon,

Our father is very worried. We have had many casualties and we need allies that contain the territories we have already conquered and prevent the south from conquering again. That’s why I’m on my way home with plans in mind. I know it’s dangerous and risky, but my mother advised me to do it. I’ll tell you more when we see each other. Send my regards to all our brothers and sisters and my dear sister-in-law.

From your blood brother and in arms,

Robb Stark.

“What is it Jon?” Daenerys noticed how worried he was.

“Robb is coming home,” he replied, “but with dangerous plans, he doesn’t tell me what it is.”

“I hope he’s careful,” she declared, contradicting herself.

Three days later Robb arrived in Winterfell and didn’t tell his brother what his plans were. Instead he proposed to walk through the White Harbor with their brothers. Jon understood his intentions behind it.

“Robb, Jon, we’ll get ahead,” Bran warned.

“Hurry up Bran” Rickon was pulling him impatiently.

“I keep an eye on the boys.” Daenerys followed them.

When they were finally alone, Robb showed his grief.

“What upset you my brother?” Jon put a hand on his shoulder to comfort him.

“My plans,” sighed Robb, “I intend to marry Roslin Frey so the Frey can provide soldiers and resources.”

“But Jeyne Westerling,” Jon replied solemnly, “you love her, didn’t you ever think of a life you could have together?”

“Yes my brother,” Robb smiled sadly, “but duty is honor, victory, that will deliver innocents from death, for an end to war. And … I can work hard to love Roslin. All love develops, you learn to love. I’m willing to make it work.”

“Have you made the proposal to Walder Frey?” Jon asked, understanding the situation.

“He came to me and I accepted,” Robb replied. “I’m determined, brother, and I will not go back.

"I hope you’re not unhappy,” Jon wanted.

“I won’t be Jon,” Robb said, “I’ll do my best to be happy.”

When they stopped talking, the little Stark came rushing to meet the brothers.

“Jon! Robb!” Rickon called,“you won’t believe what we found.”

“What are they up to, Dany?” Robb laughed relieving the tension.

“It’s a surprise,” Bran said more calmly, “just follow us.”

Jon and Robb looked at each other with a shrug and followed the boys. They came to a lane and looked at the ground, and saw five puppies.

“We want to take it home,” Bran said, “please.”

“But all of them?” Jon asked, “I don’t know if Lady Catelyn will like it.”

“It has to be all of them!” Rickon tapped one foot for each of us.

“Oh no Rick” Robb realized “it’s 5 and we’re in 6”

“You can get them and I won’t get one,” Jon decided.

“Oh my brother,” Robb laughed, “no sacrifices, please. You deserve a puppy, after all you’re a married man and as they say, we started the family with a dog.”

“We already have Dany, the cat,” Jon countered.

“But a puppy keeps her company,” Robb said like a plea, which made Bran and Rickon laugh.

It was at that moment that another puppy appeared, right at the feet of the reluctant Jon.

“Looks like you don’t have a choice now, my love.” Daenerys picked up the little puppy.

“Oh no, Dany,” her husband rolled his eyes.

“Please, my love, my brave and believed Jon Snow” Daenerys said in a sweet voice. “Can we keep him?”

“How can I say no to such a plea?” He finally persuaded himself.

The Statk returned to the Fortress and Lady Catelyn as reluctantly as Jon eventually accepted the pack.

Robb named his GreyWind, Jon’s Ghost, Arya’s Nymeria, Sansa’s Lady, Bran’s Summer, and Rickon’s ShaggyDog.

As if that were not enough, they did not know that Daenerys’ cat was pregnant and soon gave birth to three kittens. The young Mrs. Stark named them Drogon, Viserion and Rhaegal. The kitten got so attached to her and she to them that Daenerys also stayed with them.

In the midst of all that mess and excitement, it was possible to hope for a peaceful future in the midst of the war that still surrounded them.

A / N: “Jon Snow” here is an annoying nickname that soldiers gave Jon to mock him. Daenerys knows this because Robb told her. Here I am also fixing the Red Wedding, see Robb, that’s what you had to do. Yes, I made dragons into cats. That’s why the cat was called Dany, my reference to “Mother of Dragons”

“Robb is coming home,” he replied, “but with dangerous plans, he doesn’t tell me what it is.”

“I hope he’s careful,” she declared, contradicting herself.

Three days later Robb arrived in Winterfell and didn’t tell his brother what his plans were. Instead he proposed to walk through the White Harbor with their brothers. Jon understood his intentions behind it.

“Robb, Jon, we’ll get ahead,” Bran warned.

“Hurry up Bran” Rickon was pulling him impatiently.

“I keep an eye on the boys.” Daenerys followed them.

When they were finally alone, Robb showed his grief.

“What upset you my brother?” Jon put a hand on his shoulder to comfort him.

“My plans,” sighed Robb, “I intend to marry Roslin Frey so the Frey can provide soldiers and resources.”

“But Jeyne Westerling,” Jon replied solemnly, “you love her, didn’t you ever think of a life you could have together?”

“Yes my brother,” Robb smiled sadly, “but duty is honor, victory, that will deliver innocents from death, for an end to war. And … I can work hard to love Roslin. All love develops, you learn to love. I’m willing to make it work.”

“Have you made the proposal to Walder Frey?” Jon asked, understanding the situation.

“He came to me and I accepted,” Robb replied. “I’m determined, brother, and I will not go back.

"I hope you’re not unhappy,” Jon wanted.

“I won’t be Jon,” Robb said, “I’ll do my best to be happy.”

When they stopped talking, the little Stark came rushing to meet the brothers.

“Jon! Robb!” Rickon called,“you won’t believe what we found.”

“What are they up to, Dany?” Robb laughed relieving the tension.

“It’s a surprise,” Bran said more calmly, “just follow us.”

Jon and Robb looked at each other with a shrug and followed the boys. They came to a lane and looked at the ground, and saw five puppies.

“We want to take it home,” Bran said, “please.”

“But all of them?” Jon asked, “I don’t know if Lady Catelyn will like it.”

“It has to be all of them!” Rickon tapped one foot for each of us.

“Oh no Rick” Robb realized “it’s 5 and we’re in 6”

“You can get them and I won’t get one,” Jon decided.

“Oh my brother,” Robb laughed, “no sacrifices, please. You deserve a puppy, after all you’re a married man and as they say, we started the family with a dog.”

“We already have Dany, the cat,” Jon countered.

“But a puppy keeps her company,” Robb said like a plea, which made Bran and Rickon laugh.

It was at that moment that another puppy appeared, right at the feet of the reluctant Jon.

“Looks like you don’t have a choice now, my love.” Daenerys picked up the little puppy.

“Oh no, Dany,” her husband rolled his eyes.

“Please, my love, my brave and believed Jon Snow” Daenerys said in a sweet voice. “Can we keep him?”

“How can I say no to such a plea?” He finally persuaded himself.

The Statk returned to the Fortress and Lady Catelyn as reluctantly as Jon eventually accepted the pack.

Robb named his GreyWind, Jon’s Ghost, Arya’s Nymeria, Sansa’s Lady, Bran’s Summer, and Rickon’s ShaggyDog.

As if that were not enough, they did not know that Daenerys’ cat was pregnant and soon gave birth to three kittens. The young Mrs. Stark named them Drogon, Viserion and Rhaegal. The kitten got so attached to her and she to them that Daenerys also stayed with them.

In the midst of all that mess and excitement, it was possible to hope for a peaceful future in the midst of the war that still surrounded them.

A / N: “Jon Snow” here is an annoying nickname that soldiers gave Jon to mock him. Daenerys knows this because Robb told her. Here I am also fixing the Red Wedding, see Robb, that’s what you had to do. Yes, I made dragons into cats. That’s why the cat was called Dany, my reference to “Mother of Dragons”

body:

summary: ジョン・スノウとイグリット
title: ジョン・スノウとイグリット
body:
芸能人の真剣交際・電撃入籍・泥沼破局・隠し子発覚、等ゴシップ報道には全くキョーミがなく、blogに取り上げることもまずないのですが。
ゲーム・オブ・スローンズのジョン・スノウとイグリットの結婚には、驚きと共に祝福の感情が自然と湧きあがりました。ハッキリ言って、わたくしがゲイノウ人カップルにキョーミを持ったのは、キョージュとアッコちゃん以来かもしれません。

壁の向こうで出会ったジョン・スノウとイグリット。

挙式したジョン・スノウとイグリット。 
ドラマのワンシーンではなく、このお城はイグリットの実家です。

正装で式に参列したロブ・スターク。「俺の結婚式は血みどろだったな」

孫の結婚式に出席したおじいちゃんみたいなサー・ダヴォス。

サンサ・スタークとアリア・スターク。サンサの機嫌が悪いのは仕様です。

我らがティリオン・ラニスター。今日もワインをたくさん飲む。

デナーリス・ターガリエン。今日は服を着ていますが、脱げと言われれば脱ぐし、火の中にも入ります。

ナイツウォッチ同窓生のサムは、かつての童貞仲間です。

新婚旅行で来日したジョン・スノウとイグリット。築地サイコー。

blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: ‘Foreshadowing’ in the books for Jon x Sansa
title: ‘Foreshadowing’ in the books for Jon x Sansa
body:
After being informed that there is so much foreshadowing for Jon/Sansa in the books, I decided to point out some popular fallacies pushed forward by a certain section of the fandom

1. Janos Slynt: Fans often connect Sansa wanting a hero to behead frog faced Slynt and Jon doing the deed at the wall as foreshadowing. But this is actually nothing but a coincidence as there is an interesting story here. GRRM did a reading of the sample Jon chapter at a convention before the book was published and he originally had Jon hang Janos. But fans in the audience pointed out that as Ned’s son and a Northerner, Jon would do it the old way and behead Slynt. So GRRM went back and had it changed!              

https://asoiaf.westeros.org/index.php?/topic/27418-pre-adwd-spoilers-jon-3-but-actually-jon-1/                                                                                                                                                               

2. Winterfell belongs to my sister Sansa: This is often touted to show that Jon did not take up Stannis’ offer because of Sansa. This is patently untrue. Jon uses this excuse to shut Stannis up on the topic, but the reason he refuses Stannis’ offer is because Stannis demands that Jon burn the Winterfell Godswoods. Kindly read Jon’s ASoS and ADwD chapters where Jon actually debates the issue and nowhere in his POV is Sansa a consideration – ultimately it’s his fealty to the Old Gods and his oaths that makes him refuse Stannis.

3. Jon and Sansa really care about each other: No, they don’t. When Sansa is finally reminded of Jon at the end of book five she thinks - She had not thought of Jon in ages. He was only her half brother, but still … with Robb and Bran and Rickon dead, Jon Snow was the only brother that remained to her. Even here she has reservations about Jon and only thinks that it would be sweet to see him because all her real brothers were dead. She has been masquerading as a bastard in the Vale for months and yet never once thinks of or remembers the bastard brother she grew up with and who she treated as less than because of his birth. It is the same with Jon. When informed by Stannis about the Sansa/Tyrion marriage, Jon leaves the room and thinks on how Tyrion is doing as a kinslayer! He cannot spare one single thought to the sister who has been forced into marriage to the imp. Compare his utter indifference here to Cat and Robb’s anger on hearing about the Sansa’s marriage. Robb wanted to take off Tyrion’s head. Jon is not bothered.  Jon and Sansa hardly think of each other and their plots have no connection in the books.

4. Sansa thinking that the howling of the wind in the Eyrie sounds like a Ghost wolf: Apparently this means that Sansa is feeling Jon dying or something like that. One, this takes place in AFfC before Jon gets killed in ADwD (the latter half of ADwD takes place after AFfC). So Jon is not dying when Sansa hears the wind. Two, Catelyn also compares the same howling wind in the Eyrie to a wolf and three, Arya also compares the howling wind to a wolf in the Riverlands. GRRM apparently likes to compare the howling of the wind to the howling of a wolf. On the other hand, you know who actually hears a wolf at the same time Jon is dying in the snow in ADwD? - Off in the distance, a wolf howled. The sound made her feel sad and lonely, but no less hungry.

5.   The drifting snowflakes that brushed Sansa’s face like lover’s kisses foreshadows Jon/Sansa because the snowflakes here signify Jon Snow: Sansa’s last chapter in ASoS happens on a snowy, magical morning in the Vale. Sansa wakes “all at once, every nerve atingle.” And she’s in a romantic mood already. The setting is ethereal and Sansa describes the snowflakes drifting down as soft and silent as memory. She remembers Robb and the melting flakes in his hair when he hugged me. She remembers the snowflakes swirling around her as she leaves Winterfell. For Sansa the purity of the snow signifies her memories of innocence and Winterfell - She could feel the snow on her lashes, taste it on her lips. It was the taste of Winterfell. The taste of innocence. The taste of dreams. Sansa’s last chapter in ASoS, where she builds a snow castle destroyed by SweetRobin had everything to do with her memories of Winterfell and her siblings and little to do with foreshadowing a relationship with Jon Snow. If we are talking about kisses and Sansa, the Unkiss is far more popular in fandom lore.

6. GRRM for some strange reason replaced the Arya from his original outline with Sansa: An earlier post shows why this is false, but to reiterate, GRRM is still aiming for the same ending that he came up with in the early nineties. As he has always maintained, he has known what Jon, Tyrion and Arya’s journeys are and where they end up from the moment he started writing the first book. GRRM has invested in the Jon/Arya relationship for over 5 books and once Dany gets to Westeros and meets up with Jon we are getting Jon/Dany as well.

7. Jon and Sansa have so many things in common: They don’t. We are constantly told about how Jon and Sansa want to marry and have children – well, so do most of the characters in the world of Westeros. Dany wants children and a house with a red door. Tyrion wants family and home. So does Jaime and Cersei. Even Bran. But the thing is that Jon forgoes his desires, refuses Stannis’ offer and decides to do his duty. It is only his love for Arya that pushes him to break his oaths. Meanwhile Sansa is busy getting enmeshed in LF’s plots in the Vale and knowingly or unknowingly is slowly poisoning her little cousin.

So the books have basically zero foreshadowing or connection between Jon and Sansa. Just a very selective reading of the text and hyperbolic extrapolations to make connections between them.

And even the show has never really demonstrated any special bond or love between Jon and Sansa. From the time after they met, Jon and Sansa have done nothing but argue and fight. In season 6, Sansa lies to Jon about something very important and starts off season 7 by undermining him in front of the Lords and comparing him to Joffrey. Jon agrees to fight Ramsay to save Rickon and not for Sansa. Jon has no issues becoming KITN over Sansa and she resents him for that. When Arya gets to Winterfell, the show frames it as Jon/Arya Vs Sansa – with Sansa complaining about Jon and Arya sticking up for him. Sansa herself talks about how much Jon loves Arya (His heart would stop upon seeing her) compared to her and how Arya would kill her if Sansa tried to depose Jon. So therefore it is not only book canon, but also show canon that Jon and Arya love each other dearly.

That’s why Jonsa makes no sense and never has. The show has never made the case for it. They have characters openly talking about how much Jon and Arya and Jon and Dany love each other, but no one in the world of GOT apparently knows that there is this great romance – Jonsa – happening right under their nose! Amazing really.

After being informed that there is so much foreshadowing for Jon/Sansa in the books, I decided to point out some popular fallacies pushed forward by a certain section of the fandom

1. Janos Slynt: Fans often connect Sansa wanting a hero to behead frog faced Slynt and Jon doing the deed at the wall as foreshadowing. But this is actually nothing but a coincidence as there is an interesting story here. GRRM did a reading of the sample Jon chapter at a convention before the book was published and he originally had Jon hang Janos. But fans in the audience pointed out that as Ned’s son and a Northerner, Jon would do it the old way and behead Slynt. So GRRM went back and had it changed!              

https://asoiaf.westeros.org/index.php?/topic/27418-pre-adwd-spoilers-jon-3-but-actually-jon-1/                                                                                                                                                               

2. Winterfell belongs to my sister Sansa: This is often touted to show that Jon did not take up Stannis’ offer because of Sansa. This is patently untrue. Jon uses this excuse to shut Stannis up on the topic, but the reason he refuses Stannis’ offer is because Stannis demands that Jon burn the Winterfell Godswoods. Kindly read Jon’s ASoS and ADwD chapters where Jon actually debates the issue and nowhere in his POV is Sansa a consideration – ultimately it’s his fealty to the Old Gods and his oaths that makes him refuse Stannis.

3. Jon and Sansa really care about each other: No, they don’t. When Sansa is finally reminded of Jon at the end of book five she thinks - She had not thought of Jon in ages. He was only her half brother, but still … with Robb and Bran and Rickon dead, Jon Snow was the only brother that remained to her. Even here she has reservations about Jon and only thinks that it would be sweet to see him because all her real brothers were dead. She has been masquerading as a bastard in the Vale for months and yet never once thinks of or remembers the bastard brother she grew up with and who she treated as less than because of his birth. It is the same with Jon. When informed by Stannis about the Sansa/Tyrion marriage, Jon leaves the room and thinks on how Tyrion is doing as a kinslayer! He cannot spare one single thought to the sister who has been forced into marriage to the imp. Compare his utter indifference here to Cat and Robb’s anger on hearing about the Sansa’s marriage. Robb wanted to take off Tyrion’s head. Jon is not bothered.  Jon and Sansa hardly think of each other and their plots have no connection in the books.

4. Sansa thinking that the howling of the wind in the Eyrie sounds like a Ghost wolf: Apparently this means that Sansa is feeling Jon dying or something like that. One, this takes place in AFfC before Jon gets killed in ADwD (the latter half of ADwD takes place after AFfC). So Jon is not dying when Sansa hears the wind. Two, Catelyn also compares the same howling wind in the Eyrie to a wolf and three, Arya also compares the howling wind to a wolf in the Riverlands. GRRM apparently likes to compare the howling of the wind to the howling of a wolf. On the other hand, you know who actually hears a wolf at the same time Jon is dying in the snow in ADwD? - Off in the distance, a wolf howled. The sound made her feel sad and lonely, but no less hungry.

5.   The drifting snowflakes that brushed Sansa’s face like lover’s kisses foreshadows Jon/Sansa because the snowflakes here signify Jon Snow: Sansa’s last chapter in ASoS happens on a snowy, magical morning in the Vale. Sansa wakes “all at once, every nerve atingle.” And she’s in a romantic mood already. The setting is ethereal and Sansa describes the snowflakes drifting down as soft and silent as memory. She remembers Robb and the melting flakes in his hair when he hugged me. She remembers the snowflakes swirling around her as she leaves Winterfell. For Sansa the purity of the snow signifies her memories of innocence and Winterfell - She could feel the snow on her lashes, taste it on her lips. It was the taste of Winterfell. The taste of innocence. The taste of dreams. Sansa’s last chapter in ASoS, where she builds a snow castle destroyed by SweetRobin had everything to do with her memories of Winterfell and her siblings and little to do with foreshadowing a relationship with Jon Snow. If we are talking about kisses and Sansa, the Unkiss is far more popular in fandom lore.

It is only his love for Arya that pushes him to break his oaths. Meanwhile Sansa is busy getting enmeshed in LF’s plots in the Vale and knowingly or unknowingly is slowly poisoning her little cousin.

So the books have basically zero foreshadowing or connection between Jon and Sansa. Just a very selective reading of the text and hyperbolic extrapolations to make connections between them.
